website_summaries.verdict: Its relatively low price and steady performance makes this garage heater a steal.
pros: Adjustable louvers offer direct airflow -- and a leg up among close competitors
cons: We wish there was a higher heat output temperature

customer_reviews.title: Keeps the garage warm.
customer_reviews.text: Keeps my 30x30x12 garage warm even when it got bitterly cold out last week around 5 degrees with an even worse wind chill. I hooked the electric for it up myself but if you don't know what your doing get your local electrician to do that for you. I used 10 gauge wire with a dedicated 30 amp breaker and it works well. Very quiet and looks good hanging on the wall.
customer_reviews.author: quickrob

customer_reviews.title: good product for the price
customer_reviews.text: For the price, this is definitely a 5-star product. If I ended up paying $300-400 on this, it would likely be a 3 star review. I would love for it to be able to pump warmer air than it does. But it works rather well, and will warm up my 500-sq ft garage in about an hour and a half from 30 degree to 65. I mounted this over my work bench and have it angled to be pointing at where i'm usually standing, so even if I just started working in the garage, and the entire garage is cold, the area where i am standing is quite pleasant.
customer_reviews.author: Kaz

customer_reviews.title: This thing beers my 900 square shop just fine in Idaho
customer_reviews.text: I wish I could give ten stars. This thing beers my 900 square shop just fine in Idaho. This was a very hard winter and it kept the garage very comfortable even in single digit temps. Our electric bill even went down since my 110 heater would constantly work and this runs intermittently depending on the setting. Very happy with this, my brother even bought one for his shop.
customer_reviews.author: ruhtra

customer_reviews.title: A good machine...well worth the money!
customer_reviews.text: Had mine a few months now and wanted to share my experiences. I'm in Charlotte, NC so it's fairly mild here however it's been in the 30's & 40's and the heater has performed wonderfully. I have a rather large 2 - car garage, around 540 sq. ft. and no special or extra insulation. It heats the garage to 67 degrees easily. As a matter of fact I have to turn the built in thermostat down to a cooler temp. If I had it to do over I'd choose the model that has a wireless remote control. Then again, I'm disabled and need help to reach it. Would I recommend it; YES. Wound I buy another one; in a heartbeat!
customer_reviews.author: Tomcat_104

customer_reviews.title: Done after 1 year
customer_reviews.text: I liked the heater a lot. It helped me for 1 winter. Bought February 2017. Said POOF in December 2018. I called customer service and was told I would get a new fan sent to me. I would probably have to pay someone to replace the fan ,hoping that that would really be the issue with the heater. If it wasn't the problem I would have to get the heater back to them for God knows how long while my clients and me would be freezing at my business. Not worth it. I bought a new one with another company.
customer_reviews.author: Pascale

customer_reviews.title: Buy this one.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this along with the "Sealproof Power Whip Assembly, 3/4-Inch x 6 Ft Nonmetallic Liquid Tight Flexible Electrical Conduit and 8 Gauge Wire" This combo made for an easy installation into my sub panel. My garage / workshop is about 18x25' and this brings the temperature up nicely.
customer_reviews.author: Max-T

customer_reviews.title: Works great.
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install and wire if you have basic skills. Out of the box and working in 30 minutes with no issues. I have a 1000 sqft shop that is insulated and this is more that adequate to keep it comfortable. In 30 degree outside temps I've been able to run it in the low (3000W) setting at just over half way on the dial, and maintain a comfortable working environment. Fan is not obtrusive when running and the directional fins adjust easily. Mounted to the ceiling using lag bolts into the rafter. Easy to wire, I added a plug to the end that matches existing 220v outlet. Good buy, am purchasing a second one for my father.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Junk
customer_reviews.text: It never worked right.Wont stay on long enough.Some thing wrong with thermostat.Then it melted the input wire which is what it called for to operate.It puts out good heat for maybe 5 minutes and the it just shut off until it restarts when it wants to.It just wont stay on long enough to heat 400 square ft even if you turn the thermostat as high as it will go.The only good thing about is it was quiet.
customer_reviews.author: Rob

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: Heats my garage (around 700ish square ft) to probably around 50-60 degrees, pretty fast too! I do live in an burm home so that probably helps hold in the heat. But I’d say it usually sits at around 35-40, so it definitely takes the chill out. We usually hang out and play games and cards out there and feel pretty comfy! I live in ks where it’s been pretty cold this winter, I’m definitely pleased with it! Plus it’s a little guy that just mounts anywhere so the kids can’t reach it. Mine did not come with a remote, but that’s not a problem for me.
customer_reviews.author: Haley

customer_reviews.title: So far I am happy with this heater
customer_reviews.text: Installed this in my shed. Tested it out with the doors open. The outside temp was maybe 50 deg F and I had the shed doors open. Within 5 min at 6k it was extremely hot in the shed. I have insulated the shed so it does retain some heat. So far I am happy with this heater. We will see how it works in the winter with temps near or below zero. I don't plan to run this heater all the time or even often; only when I need to repair something in the shed in the middle of winter.
customer_reviews.author: Maine Geek

customer_reviews.title: Great for garage
customer_reviews.text: I now owned this heater for several winter months and find it to perform excellent for my 500 sq ft insulated garage. If you don’t mind the electric cost this is an excellent device. I have the heater set to the highest setting and it rarely turns on when the thermostat is at lowest setting when outside temp is 30 degrees. I keep the garage at 40 degrees (above freezing). The blower is excellent in strength and noise is lower than I expected. The only problem is the additional thermostat (DR-001). It tends to not shut off in the off position. But the heater is a good buy.
customer_reviews.author: K. Police

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic garage heater
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic garage heater . This unit comes ready to use with only a short amt of time to install. FYI the heater does not come with a 240v plug installed . It is set up ready to hard wire using (not supplied) a 10/2 run of wire hooked to a 35A double pull circuit . The unit is amazingly quiet , and unlike others , does not require a "cool down" cycle which allows external thermostats to be installed and uses . Again, a fantastic piece of hardware . Would buy again without a second thought !
customer_reviews.author: Empirical

customer_reviews.title: 1 year later.....
customer_reviews.text: After much research and investigation, I purchased and installed this in my newly insulated garage and it works great! It has no problem keeping the temperature very comfortable with the outside temperature in the mid to upper 20’s here in Chicago. I installed a cheap ceiling fan to direct the rising heat down, too, and now have a very comfortable woodworking shop year round.
customer_reviews.author: Carrot top

customer_reviews.title: Bare truth
customer_reviews.text: Currently live in eastern washington. Temperature has been down to near zero. But averages 26 in my lightly insulated, concrete bottom, open rafter shop of 640sqft with 8' ceiling (12' at peak). This heater raises the temp at the furthest point 29 degrees, 42 degrees midway near the benches. Noise is about the same as a cheap diswasher running or a 1990s clothes dryer. You'll have to speak up if talking next to it but it puts a smile on my face and makes it so I "want" to do some work instead of "have" to do some work. Those looking seriously at this heater know what I mean.
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: It’s junk
customer_reviews.text: Thermostat didn’t work out of box. Jerry rigged it to work and now 2 months later the on off switch doesn’t work. Strange in this age of technology, that a company cannot make a reliable heater. In the process of trying to get heater fixed or replaced but company isn’t very helpful or responsible.
customer_reviews.author: jared van vleet

customer_reviews.title: Great for Garage Heat
customer_reviews.text: Added to three car garage. Installed a baseboard heater thermostat on wall to control. Great on bitter cold winter days in keeping garage manageably warm. Installed because a) do not have a gas line to garage, b) I have a 220 line in my nearby shop I could tap power off of; c) I do staining and varnishing and spraying for wood working and know gas heat would have a pilot or spark for ignition source fire. 6000 watts takes off cold in winter without breaking bank.
customer_reviews.author: Bigredfans

customer_reviews.title: will only run on high for a short time
customer_reviews.text: heater will continually run on low (shop temp is 45 degrees) but if you turn it to high(6000 watts) it only will run for 5-6 min. then tuns off and restarts 5-6 min. later after it has cooled off. Shop temp still 45 degrees,I don't want to leave it on all the time since I-am only in the shop a couple of times a week, I was hoping that could warm up the space in a short period of time, but its not going to happen on the low setting.
customer_reviews.author: dj

customer_reviews.title: Look Elsewhere
customer_reviews.text: Stopped working after less than 1 year, I do not recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle Goodale

customer_reviews.title: shop heater
customer_reviews.text: supplemental heat for a 600 sq ft shop, OK on mild days, have nat gas Modine for cold weather, and a ceiling fan to blow the heat down. Have to know how to wire with heavy 8 ga oven wire, 1/2" flex, couldn't find that wire in any box store, luckily an electrician friend of mine had some. Also requires 35 amp double pole breaker, try to find that in a box store, ordered mine from amazon. 240v Thermostat works fine mounted 5' up the wall. Heater works well.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: great heater for basement or garage!
customer_reviews.text: great heater. using this to heat a basement space about 15x30 ft and it is more than enough. much better than a space heater. throws lots of heat and is very quiet, was very easy to mount and install. instructions are good. thanks for a high quality product!
customer_reviews.author: Matt H.

customer_reviews.title: Great value and heat output.
customer_reviews.text: Great value, heat output and the internal thermostat works wonderfully. I am using this to heat a 450 square foot garage. It will bring the temperature from 45° to 65° in about an hour. I don't know why an external thermostat is recommended, the internal temperature setting works well.
customer_reviews.author: John Galt

customer_reviews.title: No on/off switch
customer_reviews.text: Doesn’t come with a remote and has no On/off switch. Instructions actually say to turn off my flipping breaker it’s wired to. But is works. Heats the space nicely however and then isn’t too loud.
customer_reviews.author: Craftygal

customer_reviews.title: Good heater
customer_reviews.text: Does a good job for me. I use it to heat my insualted garage stall when I need to work out there. I set it for about 45 or 50 degrees, and it makes it tolerable in colder weather. It cycles on and off fine, and is not noisy. Easy to mount, and compact. Not super high quality, but good for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Riley

customer_reviews.title: Works good
customer_reviews.text: Great product for the price, and great customer service. I had a problem with the thermostat switch. I called they answered on the first ring. The person spoke English and mailed out the part asap. It heats my 2 car garage in ny no problem.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony s

customer_reviews.title: Works for Me!!
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice little heater puts out more then enough Heat. I have yet to even turn it up to the high setting or max on the low. Downside is no electric disconnect on the heater . No input cord It does not come with the bracket to install it to the wall or ceiling
customer_reviews.author: Carla Bridger

customer_reviews.title: Not much heat output
customer_reviews.text: After taking the time to install this. I turned in on, waited for about a half hour, put my hand up to the heater and felt just a bit more heat then a hairdryer. Really not worth all the hassle. I would love to return it, but I already got rid of the box. Don't buy this. Find something in a local store that you can see how it works. Amazon sucks
customer_reviews.author: Ralph Elia

customer_reviews.title: I like it a lot
customer_reviews.text: I like it a lot. Haven't had it very long yet but it heated my 22' x 22' garage very quickly (not that cold outside today..about 40 degrees). Compared to my old Berko unit that quit on me, I think I can already tell that this is going to work just fine. I used my existing 10-2 wiring and 30amp 240 volt circuit breaker and a fused disconnect. If I ever trip out something I will repost saying so.
customer_reviews.author: Daver11111

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic!
customer_reviews.text: Attached, insulated double-car garage. 9 degrees outside. 70 degrees inside after 3-4 hours of running. Fantastic! Kicking myself that I didn't do this years ago. I used a 50 amp dryer cord attached to the heater. 50 amp receptacle to a 40 amp breaker. Works like a charm. Couldn't be happier.
customer_reviews.author: FAA

customer_reviews.title: Heats up fast
customer_reviews.text: I put this in my 30x30 shop to replace and older 5000 watt heater which due to a slow fan never quite did the job - this one has a powerful fan which scatters the 6000 watt heat and 3000 much more efficiently and quicker. Very glad I bought it.
customer_reviews.author: S. Dube

customer_reviews.title: Works very well
customer_reviews.text: It keeps a two car garage well above freezing, very quietly. Downside is the electric usage is a bit intense, depending where you live, you can look for a $50/mo increase in your utility bill.
customer_reviews.author: clarity

customer_reviews.title: Works good in basement
customer_reviews.text: This is a good heater for the price. One of the wires was loose on the temperature safety and I had to disassemble and fix it. After that it works just fine.
customer_reviews.author: Lake Dweller

customer_reviews.title: BARELY ANY HEAT - DON'T BUY
customer_reviews.text: bought it to heat a 20x14x8 shop. junk. barely puts out heat, even on the 6000W setting. and there's NO on/off switch in the unit itself??? seriously??? don't waste your money.
customer_reviews.author: PM

customer_reviews.title: So good I bought a second one
customer_reviews.text: After moving into a new and bigger shop, I had to leave my first behind. This one heats my bigger shop just fine and is very easy to install.
customer_reviews.author: Duncan

customer_reviews.title: I heat a 20x28 garage that has a insulated garage ...
customer_reviews.text: I heat a 20x28 garage that has a insulated garage door and insulation in the wall and ceiling. The out side temp was 40 and the heater and no problem keeping it at 65, could of went hotter but did not want to. I live in Michigan and will review again when the temperature gets colder.
customer_reviews.author: Donna S.

customer_reviews.title: Dangerous
customer_reviews.text: Second time I turned it on I heard a loud sound in the fan then it started smoking. OMG thank goodness I was right there to immediately turn off the breaker or it would have started a fire in my 150 year old barn. This is very scary!
customer_reviews.author: margo S.

customer_reviews.title: Keeps my garage warm
customer_reviews.text: Heater works well and keeps my 24 x 24 garage warm even when it's very cold. Not cheap to run though. My only complaint and the reason I deducted one star is because the thermostat is a bit difficult to control. No way to really know what temperature it's set to.
customer_reviews.author: KeithJ0217

customer_reviews.title: Quality product.
customer_reviews.text: Powerful heater. have used it for the last three weeks in a metal walled paint booth that’s 30 x 60. Heats it quickly and maintains temp. I’d add that it’s probably the same quality as a mr heater unit
customer_reviews.author: The Butler

customer_reviews.title: Great investment.
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic heater. I had to replace my old heater in the garage and found this for less money. This unit runs less than a tenth of the time my old one did. Electric bill loves it and it keeps temps easily in the coldest weather. I use it to maintain temps in the 50 degree range and rarely see it actually running but temps are spot on every time. The garage is 20x28.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas D.

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: Installed in a relatively small space (less than 200 sq ft) with VERY poor insulation. Along with a small space heater it has been effective for a couple months with no issues. - Easy installation - Functions as advertised
customer_reviews.author: Marcus D. Ford

customer_reviews.title: Takes the pain out of working on a Ford
customer_reviews.text: Get’s my garage nice and toasty. Instead of freezing in the garage trying to work on the 302, i’m now playing Motley crüe and smoking a cigarette working on the Foxbody. 10/10, would recommend
customer_reviews.author: J. P.

customer_reviews.title: Pumps out great heat for garages
customer_reviews.text: Heats my 20 x 20 ft garage in CO winters in less than 15 minutes so I can work on my cars/motorcycles. I would highly suggest but just know there is no on/off switch. You need to unplug it when done using it and need to hardwire it.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle H

customer_reviews.title: Noisier than what I'm used to with the same heat ...
customer_reviews.text: Noisier than what I'm used to with the same heat output. From the reviews I thought this would be quieter than the old one I was replacing. I have another one on a different room which is a lot quieter. I should have just bought that same model.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Strawn Sr

customer_reviews.title: Follow the instructions concerning distances from walls and other objects
customer_reviews.text: Small enough to be moble if required. Heats my two car garage/workshop nicely.
customer_reviews.author: Captain

customer_reviews.title: delivery
customer_reviews.text: Good product. This package was not handed of directly. It was put on my front porch Who ever delivered said - Delivered Saturday Your package was handed off directly.
customer_reviews.author: Curtis P.

customer_reviews.title: Good heater but does not have a OFF/ON switch.
customer_reviews.text: Good heater but does not have a OFF/ON switch. If your breaker panel is close by this will not be a problem otherwise you will have to install a 220V inline switch, another $30.
customer_reviews.author: The Carpenter

customer_reviews.title: And it looks like the element is stretched out
customer_reviews.text: Is this normal? I'm an electrician and I noticed that the back 3rd heating element is glowing hot but the other 2 are not. And it looks like the element is stretched out. Please let me know if this is normal for this unit so I can return it if it's not.
customer_reviews.author: Allie

customer_reviews.title: Keeps me and the dog warm in the garage.
customer_reviews.text: Pretty decent heater! I'm quite happy with this purchase to date. It's a lot quieter than the model it replaced and like the heat output.
customer_reviews.author: Lorin M.

customer_reviews.title: Works good
customer_reviews.text: Puts out a lot of heat for a small heater. Heats my two car garage.
customer_reviews.author: Aeschliman

customer_reviews.title: Heat
customer_reviews.text: Heater is amazing shop now stays above 50 all winter and doesn’t use much power at all.
customer_reviews.author: zachary nelson

customer_reviews.title: This heater works beautifully. I set the thermostat a little less than ...
customer_reviews.text: Have wanted a heater for my garage for years. I live in the northeast. My garage is approximately 800 square feet. The garage is attached to the house but not insulated, nor are the doors. This heater works beautifully. I set the thermostat a little less than half way and it keeps the garage comfortable. I will turn it up higher when I'm working there and its been very comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Tom C.

customer_reviews.title: Just as described, came quick and does the job.
customer_reviews.text: Great heater, it heat up my small shop. I use to have 3 heaters running to warm up my shop. All I need is 1 Dr. heat unit. Don't buy on Ebay much better price on Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Rick Jones

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: Works great. My greenhouse heater died and I bought this to replace it. I wish I had bought this one first.
customer_reviews.author: Earl Petrone

customer_reviews.title: Great Heater for the Shop!  A Tip for Installation...
customer_reviews.text: Love the heater and the thermostat control on the front. Tip for installation... Make it easy, purchase an Ultra Whip 1/2" pre-assembled wire kit with fittings. They are made for air conditioners but work perfect for this installation! It includes 10 gauge wires in the 6 foot hose.
customer_reviews.author: Tim S.

customer_reviews.title: Ok
customer_reviews.text: It’s just ok. I bought a more expensive one at Lowe’s that stopped working after one day. But it definitely gave off more heat. So for half the price and working just fine. I’ll take less heat.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth M.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect heater for a detached garage
customer_reviews.text: This heater works great. I have a detached 2 car garage 600sq ft and it keeps it 50 degrees. When I go back to work turn up the thermostat and it gets to 60 degrees within an hour. I love that the internal coils do not get red hot but it kicks out some serious heat.
customer_reviews.author: Bob DiPierro

customer_reviews.title: Died after 3 years.
customer_reviews.text: Thermostat died. Fan comes on continuous, but the elements to not heat, and fan runs no matter what the thermostat setting is. Honestly it did not heat the garage that well for the power it consumed.
customer_reviews.author: Todd Hetrick

customer_reviews.title: Works very well for my 14x30 insulated shop. Doesn't ...
customer_reviews.text: Works very well for my 14x30 insulated shop. Doesn't get hot to the touch, but keeps recirculating the heat and blowing it off the ceiling. Can hit 70 degrees in 20 minutes when its 30 outside. As for how long it will last time will tell, i will update if it doesn't!
customer_reviews.author: Patrick

customer_reviews.title: Great heater
customer_reviews.text: Great heater for my garage and it heats up very well.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Meets expectations
customer_reviews.text: This heater is working fine, so far it’s doing what’s promised and that’s what I wanted
customer_reviews.author: 6366vette

customer_reviews.title: Good value and heat output!
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had this heat installed in my basement shop since Nov 2018. I have fairly low ceilings in my shop and it heats it up very nicely from 55 to high 60’s pretty quickly for my poorly insulated shop.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love my garage all year now.
customer_reviews.text: This unit is compact and works perfect. It keeps my garage/work area at a comfortable temp to work.
customer_reviews.author: Charles Baerman

customer_reviews.title: Very basic low heat
customer_reviews.text: If your looking for a high out put heater this is not it. This unit is a low heat unit even for the wattage used and required. The coils will not get red as support told me this is not a thermal heater. Will not buy this again.
customer_reviews.author: Dustin C.

customer_reviews.title: 6000 watt poor heat output. bad unit??
customer_reviews.text: I just hooked it up yesterday 6000watt unit. To be honest i was disappointed on the heat out put. My shop is dont yet finished with thw insulation. It is cold in shop 40* ran heater and i can place my hand in front of heater and leave it there. It dont get hot but my little 1500 watt ceramic blows hotter air then this one just not as much air as this unit. I hope this is a defective unit and i can get replaced.
customer_reviews.author: jose

customer_reviews.title: Great heaters
customer_reviews.text: The product worked great. I used 2 of these heaters to heat a complete 2000sf home during construction.
customer_reviews.author: Justin Schmidtke

customer_reviews.title: So far a great heater. I think I will add a ceiling ...
customer_reviews.text: I put mine up today and all I can say is wow! A 25 x25 garage fairly well insulated except for the two doors. I ran armored 10-2 wire straight from the panel to the heater on a 30 amp breaker and turned it on. The air temp outside was 32F and I opened a door for light because I killed the main while I hooked up the power, and within 30 minutes it was 68F in the garage and it started to cycle. So far a great heater. I think I will add a ceiling fan to push the hot air down for a little more heat. That concrete floor can hold some cold.
customer_reviews.author: Nick M.

customer_reviews.title: Works great!!!
customer_reviews.text: Works great. Had about a year now wanted to make sure be for I left a comment. Heats up my 3 car garage to 70 deg when it's in the 40's garage is not insulated and nor are the garage doors I highly recommend ...
customer_reviews.author: Enrique r.

customer_reviews.title: Puts out plenty of heat
customer_reviews.text: I thought I had a dud. After disconnecting it discovered one of the wires had come loose. Electrician said sometimes the solid thick copper and filament copper don't always make a great connection. I wish it was quieter but it sure does heat up my space quickly. 19'x19' air sealed but insufficient insulation (R21 between rafters) old garage with wood T&G paneling and concrete slab.
customer_reviews.author: Jean Hoiland

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding heater in terms of build quality and performance. ...
customer_reviews.text: Outstanding heater in terms of build quality and performance. The mounting bracket is not very stiff however, leading to some swaying when adjusting the position. It does operate quietly while moving lots of air. I use mine to heat up my garage workshop (2-car size) and it heats that space very quickly. It will beat the 700 sq ft. space from 45 to 70 degF in about 25 minutes.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin S. Callahan

customer_reviews.title: Warmth with energy efficiency
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for warming my husbands shop in the garage. Quiet, efficient and easy to regulate the thermostat.
customer_reviews.author: Bruins babe

customer_reviews.title: this was a great investment no longer have to wait till the weather ...
customer_reviews.text: this was a great investment no longer have to wait till the weather warms up to get snow off my blower
customer_reviews.author: psycho

customer_reviews.title: Works great.
customer_reviews.text: Bought it for the garage. Works great, keeps the garage warm in our cold winter temps.
customer_reviews.author: carrie wright

customer_reviews.title: Packaging
customer_reviews.text: Haven't hooked it up yet came with everything promised looks new. Packaging was a bit poor but it got where it needed to.
customer_reviews.author: Cody ojibway

customer_reviews.title: Nice inexpensive heater.
customer_reviews.text: The heater works just fine for my shop. I wired it direct without the thermostat and have had zero issues.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas L.

customer_reviews.title: Good value
customer_reviews.text: Instantly heats my 15x15x8ft high work space which is an internally divided section in my pole barn
customer_reviews.author: Buford T Justice

customer_reviews.title: Great little garage heater
customer_reviews.text: Great heater. It is installed in my garage and it was an easy install and works great.
customer_reviews.author: Bev's Apple

customer_reviews.title: Allows garage use during the worst of winter cold.
customer_reviews.text: This warms my large garage up during below freezing temperatures in about 15 minutes.
customer_reviews.author: Tom in Lynden

customer_reviews.title: Great heater
customer_reviews.text: Works great heats up my gym and keeps it dry
customer_reviews.author: Eric Dodson

customer_reviews.title: Electric heat source for workshop
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install, no thermostat needed. Does good job warming the work shop area
customer_reviews.author: Linda

customer_reviews.title: Works well for the money.
customer_reviews.text: Product was as described the only issue I saw was that the installation instructions might have been a little clearer.
customer_reviews.author: Frank Marsh

customer_reviews.title: It works.
customer_reviews.text: Works good for the price. Lowest setting keeps 3 car garage 40 degrees on a 5 degree day!
customer_reviews.author: Douglas J. Davidson

customer_reviews.title: Most importantly know your wireing
customer_reviews.text: I used this heater to heat a two car guarge it works good keeping the guarge at 70 degrees.
customer_reviews.author: SUZANNE K ALLEN

customer_reviews.title: nice heater
customer_reviews.text: The heat is really good. I have a 24x24 garage and it heated it really well airflow is great very quiet also. I would buy it again
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: T stat woors well
customer_reviews.text: the unit works well it keeps my 2 car garage heated nicely, I did insulate the ceiling and sealed any gaps around the garage door
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Does it's job!
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install, puts out decent heat for it's size and price. Shop is approx 500 sq ft, works perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Received in good shape. Product is exactly as advertised and it ...
customer_reviews.text: Received in good shape. Product is exactly as advertised and it working fine in weather up (or down!) to -25 degrees. Instructions were adequate.
customer_reviews.author: Richard H. Peterson

customer_reviews.title: Installed unit turned power on, overheated. looked inside ...
customer_reviews.text: Installed unit turned power on, overheated. looked inside and the fan blades were not installed on fan motor and laying inside. Took back off and install blades on motor, powered it back up, heater came on but fan motor hummed but did not rotate fan blades. Unit is waiting to be returned.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: it works
customer_reviews.text: It works as described. My unit was in used condition on arrival.
customer_reviews.author: Jayknife

customer_reviews.title: Heater
customer_reviews.text: Good for the shop or garage works great keeps me warm while I'm working.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Pogue

customer_reviews.title: I use 2 of these in 980 SF super insulated shop (Ohio Valley)
customer_reviews.text: Thermostats are all over the place. I use 2 of these in 980 SF super insulated shop (Ohio Valley), they will never keep up.
customer_reviews.author: Toon

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Heater for the money
customer_reviews.text: I just installed the heater in my garage. It's a 2.5 car garage, no insulation, with drywall in Michigan. I wanted a heater so I can work on cars in the winter and this does it and more. On full blast you will be in shorts and a t-shirt sweating. I used 10-2 wire and plug to an existing welding outlet so I can unplug it when needed.
customer_reviews.author: Blake

customer_reviews.title: Works incredibly well!
customer_reviews.text: I have a 16x16 workshop and this gets the room warmed up in about 10 minutes. Runs nice and quietly too.
customer_reviews.author: Mr A M Chapman

customer_reviews.title: Heater works great with just one flaw
customer_reviews.text: Heater works great with just one flaw...The thermostat on this thing is junk. Seriously, its a great heater and the price cant be beat but DO NOT INSTALL WITHOUT A LINE LEVEL THERMOSTAT! Installed without first and temp was all over the board. Spent approx $25 on a Honeywell CT410B and it is awesome!
customer_reviews.author: Brandon B.

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic product
customer_reviews.text: The heater is outstanding!! Heats my insulated two car garage with ease.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not what I expected.
customer_reviews.text: Quiet, but doesn't put out the kind of heat I expected it would. Barely takes the chill out of the cellar workshop.
customer_reviews.author: James K. Hosford Jr.

customer_reviews.title: I love it.
customer_reviews.text: It is pretty quiet & heats very well. I am using it in my garage 540 sq. ft.
customer_reviews.author: Motor Lar

customer_reviews.title: Good heater
customer_reviews.text: Works great with a thermostat. Heats garage in sub-zero weather.
customer_reviews.author: Bob Reutter

customer_reviews.title: Buy the one that has just the dial, not the one with digital remote
customer_reviews.text: The heater doesn’t stay running on 600w it shuts off after 15 minutes or so!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Husband put this in the shop & he's very pleased!!
customer_reviews.author: Angel

customer_reviews.title: Keeps up with capacity to spare
customer_reviews.text: I use this to heat my 1100 square foot work shop. It works well.
customer_reviews.author: BA

customer_reviews.title: Like it alot
customer_reviews.text: Like it alot. Made a big difference in the garage. No more frost on the ceiling. I have it on the 3000 amp. And the temp. Dial turned to almost off and it stays around 50 degrees when its about 10 degrees outside.
customer_reviews.author: Cary W. Brown

product_meta.title: Dr. Heater DR966 240-volt Hardwired Shop Garage Commercial Heater, 3000-watt/6000-watt, DR966 240V
product_meta.description: Style Name:DR966 240VNeed safe, comfort and quick heat? This DR966 3000/6000W industrial heater can be easily installed in either your new or remodeled building. Dr966 can be your primary or auxiliary heat source for your garage, factories, stores, warehouses, workshops, schools, churches, hospitals, dormitories or any exposed areas. DR966 uses spiral steel metal sheath electric heating elements with low sheath temperatures provide uniform heat and long service life. Plus a large, matched, dynamically 8" fan provide maximum air flow with minimum turbulence and noise, gently distributes warmth through your area. Totally enclosed, thermally protected, heavy duty ball bearing motor features permanently lubricated provides long life and low maintenance. Built-in adjustable thermostat allows to set your desire style. Rugged stamped steel front cover with five-way adjustable louvers for easy control airflow. Ceiling and wall mounting bracket are included. Finished in a gray epoxy paint. UL & CUL Listed. 1 Year parts and labor Warranty.
feature_bullets: Heavy Duty 240V Single Phase 3000/6000W Commercial Electric Heater
Hardwired; Power cord not included in the unit. Dimensions: Overall Height - Top to Bottom: -14.5". Overall Width - Side to Side: -13". Overall Depth - Front to Back: -14.5".
UL/CUL Listed Wall or Ceiling Mounted Heater; Bracket Included
5 Adjustable Louvers for to Direct Airflow
Adjustable Thermostat with HIGH and LOW Setting. A dynamically 8 inch fan provide maximum air flow with minimum turbulence and noise, gently distributes warmth through your area
